title: 4 shot: 3 dead, 2 hospitalized
content:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla.-- The search is on for whomever shot four people on the city's Northside Sunday evening, according to the Jacksonville Sheriff's Office.
Three men were pronounced dead at the scene of the shooting. JSO says two women were taken to UF Health in Jacksonville with injuries; one of them had been shot.
At this time, police say the condition of the women is not known. One woman was in surgery and another victim was being prepped for surgery at last check Sunday night.
Investigators say they got a tip about 7:45 p.m. that several people had been shot on the 7300 block of Linda Drive. When officers arrived, they found two male victims dead at the intersection of Linda Drive. The third male victim was found dead in a home nearby, investigators say.
The women showed up to UF Health a short time later. While it was initially believed both had been shot, JSO said Monday one of the women's injuries were not from gunfire.
Investigators are calling this a very large crime scene and say they will continue to process the area for evidence and clues until daylight.
The male victims haven't been identified yet, but authorities say they believe the men are in their late teens or early 20's.
Investigators say several people were in the area when the shooting happened. Call Crime Stoppers at 1-866-845-TIPS if you have any information about this case.
